message: ok, ignore me then :)

Now that I'm getting more requests to join the 6a alumni group, I'm noticing that requests don't seem to show up in the top nav as quickly as I get the email. I remember at one point seeing a Request item show up in the top nav, but most of the time, so I know that that feature exists, but I'm not sure what triggers it.
can't tell if it's a bug, or I don't understand the business rules.
@djchall seems like a bug
Weird, it shows up for me
yep
I experienced the same thing today
Sorry had to go AFK a sec, so what's going on?
That is sooo odd, I'm right now as I type staring at a requests button because I have an outstanding request
I'll make sure we're adding those two numbers, my suspicion is that I'm just looking at the one
@alex Ahh yeah, it's not hooked up to realtime yet
But @djchall IMO is a bug
ok that came out wrong
@ericflo so what exactly happens? you get an email requesting to join a private group, and the top nav shows the request menu around the same time?
what browser are you in?
whoops, i'm sorry, that was in safari.. and those were invitations to join a public group
i was seeing this in firefox
i just glanced at chrome running on my macbook air, and saw the menu
maybe it's a browser thing
@ericflo yeah, technically a request to approve someone joining a private group
sorry, should have been more clear
My experience:
i was once described as the anti-pattern
It's not showing "Requests (1)"
That particular thing isn't so much a bug as it is...we just haven't built that yet :)
The behavior @djchall described is a bug
Not @djchall himself, @djchall is the anti-bug, has been super super helpful :)
@ericflo okay, i tested again, and even in safari, i strongly suspect that triggering changes in the top nav when a request to join occurs is broken
@ericflo no.... i've repro'ed it so far in firefox and safari
Oh wait, you're saying it's a request to join a group?
That must be it, my request is a request for *me* to join a group
@ericflo yeah, i've verified that those events do cause the requests menu to appear in the top nav
I'm on convore, get an email about a join request; tab over to convore, no requests displayed, refresh: request visible
(those events = invitations to join a group)
@alex okay, that's a different issue than what i'm describing
I'd like to to be real-time :)
ok BRB gonna grab dinner quick then fix bug
by an engineering manager at 6a
@ericflo so i just looked in safari and saw the requests menu had appeared
i'll try again now
sorry, I know it's not ideal, but yeah I don't consider it a "bug" per se, just something we need to implement soon :)
I can't reproduce this
so the question is, how long did it take?
True, true
It shouldn't take any time, it doesn't go through a queue or anything, it goes directly into the database, and isn't cached...I'd be severely worried if there were a delay.
okay, i've sent a join request for further apart to my djchall user
the email has already been received
i'm going to reload the page
ah, okay, now i see it
so that's the problem... it requires a page reload
lol jk
but i don't see the requests menu up in the nav
ahhhhh ok
yeah, it's not real-time yet
yeah
okay, so it was basically the same issue @alex was reporting
okay, that's fine
i mean, i would still consider it a bug because the rest of the top nav notifications are top nav, but it's a known issue
And it seems like it's tripped up at least two people
@ericflo let's debate the meaning of the word "bug"!
as long as it's a known issue i'm happy
